intro: Cordyline ensifolia, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used traditionally by Māori for its fibrous leaves. Cordyline ensifolia is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil.
